p.k: A fascinating look at the life and career of Shirley MacLaine, one of Hollywood's legendary leading ladies, who starred in films including The Apartment and Sweet Charity
Film experts reflect on the work of Charles Bronson, who became a Hollywood star with his tough-guy, vigilante roles in films such as The Magnificent Seven and Death Wish
New. Ravishing production of Puccini's Japanese tragedy from The Royal Opera, starring Ermonela Jaho as Cio-Cio-San. Antonio Pappano conducts
Competition in which budding artists are challenged to paint a scene in four hours
The Landlady When a young man arrives in Bath, he is shocked to find his seemingly charming landlady has a dark side
Neck A young lady is cut down to size by her husband's loyal butler when it is discovered she is having an affair
A fascinating look at the life and career of Shirley MacLaine, one of Hollywood's legendary leading ladies, who starred in films including The Apartment and Sweet Charity
Film experts reflect on the work of Charles Bronson, who became a Hollywood star with his tough-guy, vigilante roles in films such as The Magnificent Seven and Death Wish
What's Goin' On American popular music explodes into new formats, while established artists, including Blondie, Billy Joel and KISS find new ways to express themselves
Edward the Conqueror When Edward grows tired of his wife Louisa's obsession with a stray cat and decides to get rid of it, Louisa exacts her revenge
A Dip in the Pool An American gambler must come up with a cunning plan to slow down a ship at sea in order to win a bet
This special film follows the winner of Landscape Artist of the Year 2017 to Jamaica, where they will paint the breathtaking view from Noel Coward's home, Firefly

p.n: Portrait Artist Of The Year 2017 III (9)
p.k: Painting Graham Norton. This special film joins the Sky Arts Portrait Artist of the Year 2017 as they collect a ?10,000 commission to paint broadcaster Graham Norton
A fascinating look at the life and work of Peter O'Toole, the late stage and film actor who shot to fame by playing TE Lawrence in Lawrence of Arabia
An intimate portrait of Joan Fontaine, the Academy Award-winning actress who appeared in such films as Rebecca , Suspicion (1941), Jane Eyre (1944) and Othello (1952)
The State of the Union is Not Good America goes from bad to worse as the country deals with one crisis after another throughout the Ford and Carter years
Stephen Mangan and Joan Bakewell hunt for the country's best landscape artist. The competition begins in Yorkshire, where the contestants paint Fountains Abbey
Frank Skinner and Joan Bakewell search for a new star portrait artist. The celebrity sitters opening the series are David Tennant, Michaela Coel and James Morrison
